intro: Periphanes, commonly known as the "southern star" or "star of Bethlehem," is a flowering plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant features showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink, with prominent yellow stamens. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Periphanes thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
